definition: to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)

sentences.english: To avoid duplication, please do not mail faxed order form.
sentences.chinese: 已傳真表格，毋須再郵寄，以免重複。

sentences.english: All competition details of the preliminary and final will be informed by post.
sentences.chinese: 有關初賽及決賽之資料及結果將以郵寄方式通知。

sentences.english: Please send this letter by airmail.
You should get your new card in the mail in about a week.
sentences.chinese: 一星期內你就應該可以收到郵寄去的新卡。

sentences.english: I request for statement by post. HK$20/month will be charged.
sentences.chinese: 本人要求郵寄月結單，每月手續費爲$20。

sentences.english: Orders are taken by mail, and the goods are sent out from a central point where they are stored.
sentences.chinese: 定貨單是郵寄來的，貨物是從貯存中心發出去的。

sentences.english: Any parcels over the max weight should be repacked into small ones.
sentences.chinese: 凡超過重量限度的包裹應分爲幾個小包裹郵寄。

sentences.english: In order to promote business between us, we are airmailing you samples, under separate cover, for your inspection.
sentences.chinese: 爲促進雙方業務往來，另封航郵寄上樣品，供你參考。

sentences.english: Please post the original order form with a crossed cheque to the council.
sentences.chinese: 請再將已傳真之表格正本連同劃線支票郵寄至本協會。

sentences.english: The price is including the post service in HK, if post to the other country will be charge the additional fee.
sentences.chinese: 價目只包本港郵寄服務，如海外郵遞服務須另加收費。

sentences.english: FYI, the mailing address will be announced later.
The key which you posted was in the locked letter-box too.
sentences.chinese: 你郵寄的鑰匙也在鎖着的信箱裏。

sentences.english: For oversea exhibitors, we will send the Admission Ticket by airmail.
sentences.chinese: 主辦單位將會以空郵寄出入場券予海外參展商。

sentences.english: Certificates of Second and Third Class Honour will be sent to school by mail after the ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 二等及三等獎獎狀將於頒獎禮後郵寄至學校。

sentences.english: Don't e-mail it without sending a copy in the post as well.
sentences.chinese: 用電子郵件發送簡歷，同時也要郵寄一份。

definition: to fill in a form/to write data in a box (on a questionnaire or web form)
email/abbr. for 電子郵件|电子邮件[dian4 zi3 you2 jian4]
to present/to give/to hand over/to hand in/to lay before
to place an order/to order/an order (of goods)
to transmit/to dispatch/to issue (an official document or credential)
